thread.title: Mitchell Starc Not Writing Virat Kohli Off, Is Wary Of The Fact That He Will Come Back With A Vengeance - Indiatimes.com
thread.title_full: Mitchell Starc Not Writing Virat Kohli Off, Is Wary Of The Fact That He Will Come Back With A Vengeance - Indiatimes.com

title: Mitchell Starc Not Writing Virat Kohli Off, Is Wary Of The Fact That He Will Come Back With A Vengeance - Indiatimes.com
text:
Indiatimes February 28, 2017 
Mitchell Starc won the opening duel against Virat Kohli by getting him out for a duck in the first Test, but the Aussie pacer insists the battle is far from over. 
BCCL 
Also Read: V irat Kohli And His Boys Will Soon Lose 'Star' From Their Jersey As The Company Is Not Bidding For Sponsorship Rights 
Starc triggered India's downfall in last week's first Test in Pune by claiming the wickets of Cheteshwar Pujara and Kohli in quick succession in the first innings before left-arm spinner Steve O'Keefe took charge. 
Australia bowled out India for paltry totals of 105 and 107 in the two innings, with O'Keefe taking a total of 12 wickets as the visitors wrapped up a 333-run win inside three days. 
Kohli, who has been in red-hot form in recent months, had a rare failure with scores of 0 and 13 in his two outings. 
BCCL 
Also Read: Great Honour For Virat Kohli As World's Leading Cricket Site Names Him The Best Captain Of 2016 
Guilty of chasing Starc's wide delivery outside the off-stump, Kohli gave away a catch to Peter Handscomb at first slip and the batting soon fell apart on a sharply turning wicket. 
"We know (Kohli) is going to be another key wicket for the rest of the series. There's six more times we've got to get him out to really cement this series," Starc told reporters. 
"We know he'll come back bigger and stronger, but he's one I'll take over Pujara at the moment," Starc said when asked to rate the importance of his twin strikes in Pune. 
Starc and Kohli are former team-mates for the Indian Premier League (IPL) side Royal Challengers Bangalore, and the Australian is well aware of how dangerous the Indian skipper can be once he gets his eye in. Don't Miss
